thread.title: Next for Saints: Atlanta Falcons stay undefeated with OT win against Washington
thread.title_full: Next for Saints: Atlanta Falcons stay undefeated with OT win against Washington | NOLA.com

author: Christopher Dabe, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: Next for Saints: Atlanta Falcons stay undefeated with OT win against Washington
text:
The Atlanta Falcons will take an undefeated record to New Orleans for a Thursday night game against the Saints. The Falcons (5-0) won in overtime Sunday with a return of an interception by Robert Alford to beat the Washington Redskins 25-19.
Devonta Freeman scored on a 6-yard run to put the Falcons ahead 19-16 with 24 seconds left. Former Saints kicker Dustin Hopkins tied the score at 19 with a 52-yard field goal for the Redskins as regulation time expired.
Alford returned the interception 59 yards for the touchdown on the opening possession of overtime.
Freeman, who has emerged as a feature back for the Falcons, ran 27 times for 153 yards and the touchdown. The Redskins intercepted Matt Ryan twice. The interception for Alford was his second of the game.
The Saints lost to the Philadelphia Eagles 39-17 and dropped to 1-4 on the season.
Kirk Cousins to Robert Alford. Walk-off pick six in overtime...FOR THE WIN! #WASvsATL http://t.co/aN5UdvEvnC
